node.title: A ‘Nutcracker’ Performance Is Canceled, as the Virus Halts Holiday Shows
node.alt: A New York City Ballet performance of “George Balanchine’s The Nutcracker” was canceled Tuesday evening after members of the production tested positive for the virus.
node.description: New York City Ballet canceled Tuesday night’s performance, and a performance of Handel’s “Messiah” at Carnegie Hall was called off.
node.content: ["New York City Ballet canceled a performance of \u201cGeorge Balanchine\u2019s The Nutcracker\u201d on Tuesday after several people involved in the production tested positive for the coronavirus, in the latest sign of how the surge in cases is disrupting attempts to bring back some of the city\u2019s most beloved holiday performances.", "As the production, one of City Ballet\u2019s most popular, was called off at Lincoln Center, plans to fill Carnegie Hall on Tuesday evening with the \u201cHallelujah\u201d chorus were canceled when Music Sacra postponed a performance of Handel\u2019s \u201cMessiah,\u201d citing the virus. And there are no more holiday kicklines at Radio City Music Hall: The remaining performances of the \u201cChristmas Spectacular Starring the Radio City Rockettes\u201d were canceled Friday.", "The cancellations came shortly after it was announced that some of Broadway\u2019s biggest hits would not resume until after Christmas, forgoing one of their most lucrative periods of the year amid concerns about the spread of the Omicron variant.", "It was not immediately clear when performances of \u201cThe Nutcracker\u201d would return.", "\u201cWe are very disappointed to have to cancel this evening\u2019s performance,\u201d Jonathan Stafford, the company\u2019s artistic director, said in a statement, \u201cbut the safety of our artists, staff and audiences has been New York City Ballet\u2019s No. 1 priority since the Covid-19 pandemic began.\u201d", "The company has worked hard to bring back the holiday favorite under difficult circumstances. It turned to a cast of dancers 12 and older \u2014 it typically casts younger, smaller children as its angels, soldiers and mice, and for its party scene \u2014 since only children of those ages were eligible for vaccinations when rehearsals began in the fall.", "The company said that ticket holders could exchange tickets for a future performance, get refunds or donate the tickets to the company. Music Sacra, which postponed its Tuesday night performance because of positive coronavirus tests among members of its performing ensemble, said that it would perform later this season at Carnegie Hall.", "It is not only New York that is seeing holiday performances canceled. A number of performances of \u201cA Christmas Carol\u201d at the Center Theater Group in Los Angeles were recently canceled, with the theater saying that it would not come back until after Christmas."]
